fns.name: cy.animate
fns.descr: Animate the viewport.

args.name: options
args.descr: An object containing the details of the animation.

fields.name: zoom
fields.descr: A zoom level (number) or a zoom configuration object to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: level
fields.descr: The zoom level to use.

fields.name: position
fields.descr: The position about which zooming occurs.  This automatically modifies the pan such that the specified model position remains at the same position in the viewport extent during zooming.

fields.name: renderedPosition
fields.descr: The rendered position about which zooming occurs, as an alternative to using the model position.  This automatically modifies the pan such that the model position, corresponding to the rendered position at the start of the animation, remains at the same position in the viewport extent during zooming.

fields.name: pan
fields.descr: A panning position to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: panBy
fields.descr: A relative panning position to which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: fit
fields.descr: An object containing fitting options from which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: Elements or a selector to which the viewport will be fitted.

fields.name: padding
fields.descr: Padding to use with the fitting (default `0`).

fields.name: center
fields.descr: An object containing centring options from which the graph will be animated.

fields.name: eles
fields.descr: Elements or a selector to which the viewport will be centred.

fields.name: duration
fields.descr: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.

fields.name: queue
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether to queue the animation (default `true`).  Queued animations on the core run in order until the queue is empty.

fields.name: easing
fields.descr: A [`transition-timing-function`](#style/transition-animation) easing style string that shapes the animation progress curve.

fields.name: complete
fields.descr: A function to call when the animation is done.

fields.name: step
fields.descr: A function to call each time the animation steps.

fns.name: cy.png
fns.descr: Export the current graph view as a PNG image.

args.name: options
args.descr: The export options.

fields.descr: Whether the output should be `'base64uri'` (default), `'base64'`, `'blob'`, or `'blob-promise'` (a promise that resolves to the blob is returned).

fields.name: bg
fields.descr: The background colour of the image (transparent by default).

fields.descr: Whether to export the current viewport view (`false`, default) or the entire graph (`true`).

fields.name: scale
fields.descr: This value specifies a positive number that scales the size of the resultant image.

fields.descr: Specifies the scale automatically in combination with `maxHeight` such that the resultant image is no wider than `maxWidth`.

fns.descr: Export the current graph view as a JPG image.

args.descr: The export options.

fields.descr: Whether the output should be `'base64uri'` (default), `'base64'`, `'blob'`, or `'blob-promise'` (a promise that resolves to the blob is returned).

fields.name: bg
fields.descr: The background colour of the image (white by default).

fields.name: full
fields.descr: Whether to export the current viewport view (`false`, default) or the entire graph (`true`).

fields.name: scale
fields.descr: This value specifies a positive number that scales the size of the resultant image.

fields.descr: Specifies the scale automatically in combination with `maxHeight` such that the resultant image is no wider than `maxWidth`.

fields.name: maxHeight
fields.descr: Specifies the scale automatically in combination with `maxWidth` such that the resultant image is no taller than `maxHeight`.

fields.name: quality
fields.descr: Specifies the quality of the image from `0` (low quality, low filesize) to `1` (high quality, high filesize).  If not set, the browser's default quality value is used.

fns.name: eles.merge
fns.descr: Perform a in-place merge of the given elements into the calling collection.

args.name: eles

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector representing the elements to merge.  All elements in the graph matching the selector are used as the passed collection.

fns.name: eles.unmerge
fns.descr: Perform an in-place operation on the calling collection to remove the given elements.

args.name: eles
args.descr: The elements to remove in-place.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector representing the elements to remove.  All elements in the graph matching the selector are used as the passed collection.

fns.name: eles.filter
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing elements that are accepted by the specified filter function or selector.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)

fields.name: ele
fields.descr: The current element.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index of the current element.

fields.name: eles

args.name: thisArg

formats.name: eles.nodes

formats.name: eles.edges

fns.name: eles.sort
fns.descr: Get a new collection containing the elements sorted by the specified comparison function.

args.name: function(ele1, ele2)
args.descr: The sorting comparison function that returns a negative number for `ele1` before `ele2`, 0 for `ele1` same as `ele2`, or a positive number for `ele1` after `ele2`.

fns.name: eles.map
fns.descr: Get an array containing values mapped from the collection.

args.name: function(ele, i, eles)

fields.name: ele

fields.name: i

args.name: thisArg

fns.name: eles.reduce
fns.descr: Reduce a single value by applying a function against an accumulator and each value of the collection.

args.name: function(prevVal, ele, i, eles)

fields.name: prevVal

fields.name: ele

formats.name: eles.closedNeighborhood

fns.name: eles.components
fns.descr: Get the connected components.

formats.name: eles.components
formats.descr: Get the connected components, considering only the elements in the calling collection.  An array of collections is returned, with each collection representing a component.

formats.name: eles.componentsOf
formats.descr: Get the connected components to which the passed elements belong.  The components consider only the subgraph made by the elements in the calling collection.  An array of collections is returned, with each collection representing a component.

args.name: root

formats.name: ele.component
formats.descr: Get the connected component for the calling element.  The component considers all elements in the graph.

fns.name: nodes.edgesWith

args.name: eles

args.name: selector

fns.name: nodes.edgesTo
fns.descr: Get the edges coming from the collection (i.e. the source) going to another collection (i.e. the target).

args.name: eles

args.descr: The other collection, specified as a selector which is matched against all elements in the graph.

fns.name: nodes.connectedEdges

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: edges.sources

args.name: selector

fns.name: edge.target

fns.name: edges.codirectedEdges

args.name: selector

fns.name: nodes.roots
fns.descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are roots (i.e. no incoming edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.leaves
fns.descr: From the set of calling nodes, get the nodes which are leaves (i.e. no outgoing edges, as in a directed acyclic graph).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.outgoers
fns.descr: Get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.successors
fns.descr: Recursively get edges (and their targets) coming out of the nodes in the collection (i.e. the outgoers, the outgoers' outgoers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.incomers
fns.descr: Get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.predecessors
fns.descr: Recursively get edges (and their sources) coming into the nodes in the collection (i.e. the incomers, the incomers' incomers, ...).

args.name: selector
args.descr: An optional selector that is used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: eles.breadthFirstSearch
fns.descr: Perform a [breadth-first search](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breadth-first_search) within the elements in the collection.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

fields.name: visit: function(v, e, u, i, depth)
fields.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: v
fields.descr: The current node.

fields.name: e
fields.descr: The edge connecting the previous node to the current node.

fields.name: u
fields.descr: The previous node.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.depthFirstSearch
fns.descr: Perform a [depth-first search](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depth-first_search) within the elements in the collection.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root nodes (selector or collection) to start the search from.

fields.name: visit: function(v, e, u, i, depth)
fields.descr: A handler function that is called when a node is visited in the search.  The handler returns `true` when it finds the desired node, and it returns `false` to cancel the search.

fields.name: v
fields.descr: The current node.

fields.name: e
fields.descr: The edge connecting the previous node to the current node.

fields.name: u
fields.descr: The previous node.

fields.name: i
fields.descr: The index indicating this node is the ith visited node.

fields.name: depth
fields.descr: How many edge hops away this node is from the root nodes.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.dijkstra
fns.descr: Perform [Dijkstra's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dijkstra%27s_algorithm) algorithm on the elements in the collection.  This finds the shortest paths to all other nodes in the collection from the root node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the algorithm starts.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the cost of going from one node to another node.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.aStar
fns.descr: Perform the [A*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A*_search_algorithm) search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path from the root node to the goal node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the search starts.

fields.name: goal
fields.descr: The goal node (selector or collection) where the search ends.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the cost of going from one node to another node.

fields.name: heuristic: function(node)
fields.descr: A function that returns an estimation (cannot be overestimation) on the shortest distance  from the current node to the goal.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.floydWarshall
fns.descr: Perform the [Floyd-Warshall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floyd%E2%80%93Warshall_algorithm) search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path between all pairs of nodes.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the numeric weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the cost of going from one node to another node.  The weight may be positive or negative, but no negative cycles are allowed.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.bellmanFord
fns.descr: Perform the [Bellman-Ford](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bellman%E2%80%93Ford_algorithm) search algorithm on the elements in the collection. This finds the shortest path from the starting node to all other nodes in the collection.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) where the search starts.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the numeric weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the cost of going from one node to another node.  The weight may be positive or negative.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm should only go along edges from source to target (default `false`).

fns.name: eles.kruskal
fns.descr: Perform [Kruskal's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kruskal%27s_algorithm) algorithm on the elements in the collection, returning the minimum spanning tree, assuming undirected edges.

args.name: function(edge)
args.descr: A function that returns the positive numeric weight for the edge.

fns.name: eles.kargerStein
fns.descr: Finds the minimum cut in a graph using the [Karger-Stein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karger%27s_algorithm#Karger.E2.80.93Stein_algorithm) algorithm. The optimal result is found with a high probability, but without guarantee.

fns.name: eles.degreeCentrality
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the [degree centrality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrality#Degree_centrality) of the specified root node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) for which the centrality calculation is made.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the importance of the edge, with a high value representing high importance.

fields.name: alpha
fields.descr: The alpha value for the centrality calculation, ranging on [0, 1].  With value 0 (default), disregards edge weights and solely uses number of edges in the centrality calculation.  With value 1, disregards number of edges and solely uses the edge weights in the centrality calculation.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the directed indegree and outdegree centrality is calculated (`true`) or whether the undirected centrality is calculated (`false`, default).

fns.name: eles.degreeCentralityNormalized
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the normalised [degree centrality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrality#Degree_centrality) of the nodes.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the importance of the edge, with a high value representing high importance.

fields.name: alpha
fields.descr: The alpha value for the centrality calculation, ranging on [0, 1].  With value 0 (default), disregards edge weights and solely uses number of edges in the centrality calculation.  With value 1, disregards number of edges and solely uses the edge weights in the centrality calculation.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the directed indegree and outdegree centrality is calculated (`true`) or whether the undirected centrality is calculated (`false`, default).

fns.name: eles.closenessCentrality
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the [closeness centrality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Closeness_centrality) of the specified root node.

fields.name: root
fields.descr: The root node (selector or collection) for which the centrality calculation is made.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the importance of the edge, with a high value representing high importance.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm operates on edges in a directed manner from source to target (`true`) or whether the algorithm operates in an undirected manner (`false`, default).

fields.name: harmonic
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm calculates the harmonic mean (`true`, default) or the arithmetic mean (`false`) of distances.  The harmonic mean is very useful for graphs that are not strongly connected.

fns.name: eles.closenessCentralityNormalized
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the [closeness centrality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Closeness_centrality) of the nodes.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the importance of the edge, with a high value representing high importance.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm operates on edges in a directed manner from source to target (`true`) or whether the algorithm operates in an undirected manner (`false`, default).

fields.name: harmonic
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm calculates the harmonic mean (`true`, default) or the arithmetic mean (`false`) of distances.  The harmonic mean is very useful for graphs that are not strongly connected.

fns.name: eles.betweennessCentrality
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the [betweenness centrality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Betweenness_centrality) of the nodes.

fields.name: weight: function(edge)
fields.descr: A function that returns the positive weight for the edge.  The weight indicates the importance of the edge, with a high value representing high importance.

fields.name: directed
fields.descr: A boolean indicating whether the algorithm operates on edges in a directed manner from source to target (`true`) or whether the algorithm operates in an undirected manner (`false`, default).

fns.name: eles.pageRank
fns.descr: Rank the nodes in the collection using the [Page Rank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PageRank) algorithm.

fields.name: dampingFactor
fields.descr: The [damping factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PageRank#Damping_factor), affecting how long the algorithm goes along the topology of the graph (default `0.8`).

fields.name: precision
fields.descr: Numeric parameter that represents the required precision (default `0.000001`).  The algorithm stops when the difference between iterations is this value or less.

fields.name: iterations
fields.descr: Maximum number of iterations to perform (default `200`).

fns.name: eles.markovClustering
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, run the [Markov cluster algorithm](https://micans.org/mcl/) of the nodes.

fields.name: attributes: [ function(edge) ... ]
fields.descr: An array of attribute functions, each of which returns a numeric attribute value for the specified edge.  Attributes are used to cluster the nodes; i.e. the attributes of an edge indicate similarity between its nodes.

fields.name: expandFactor
fields.descr: A number that affects time of computation and cluster granularity to some extent: `M * M` (default `2`)

fields.name: inflateFactor
fields.descr: A number that affects cluster granularity (the greater the value, the more clusters): `M(i,j) / E(j)` (default `2`)

fields.name: multFactor
fields.descr: Optional number of self loops for each node. Use a neutral value to improve cluster computations (default `1`).

fields.name: maxIterations
fields.descr: Maximum number of iterations of the MCL algorithm in a single run (default `20`).

fns.name: nodes.kMeans
fns.descr: Considering only the nodes in the calling collection, calculate the [k-means clustering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-means_clustering) of the nodes.

fields.name: attributes: [ function( node ) ... ]
fields.descr: An array of attribute functions, each of which returns a numeric attribute value for the specified node.  Attributes are used to cluster the nodes; i.e. two nodes with similar attributes tend to be in the same cluster.  Each attribute may have to be normalised in order for the chosen distance metric to make sense.  Attributes must be specified unless a custom `distance: function( nodeP, nodeQ )` is specified.

fields.name: k
fields.descr: The number of clusters to return.

fields.name: distance
fields.descr: The distance classifier used to compare attribute vectors.  It is optional if attributes are specified.  It may take on one of several values:

fields.name: 'euclidean'
fields.descr: [Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance) (default)

fields.name: 'squaredEuclidean'
fields.descr: [Squared Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance#Squared_Euclidean_distance)

fields.name: 'manhattan'
fields.descr: [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry)

fields.name: 'max'
fields.descr: [Max distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_norm)

fields.name: function( length, getPAt, getQAt[, nodeP, nodeQ] )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between attribute vectors `p` and `q`.

fields.name: length
fields.descr: The length of the vectors.

fields.name: getPAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `p` vector.

fields.name: getQAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `q` vector.

fields.name: maxIterations
fields.descr: The maximum number of iterations of the algorithm to run (default `10`).

fields.name: sensitivityThreshold
fields.descr: The coefficients difference threshold used to determine whether the algorithm has converged (default `0.001`).

fns.name: nodes.kMedoids
fns.descr: Considering only the nodes in the calling collection, calculate the [k-medoids clustering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-medoids) of the nodes.

fields.name: attributes: [ function( node ) ... ]
fields.descr: An array of attribute functions, each of which returns a numeric attribute value for the specified node.  Attributes are used to cluster the nodes; i.e. two nodes with similar attributes tend to be in the same cluster.  Each attribute may have to be normalised in order for the chosen distance metric to make sense.  Attributes must be specified unless a custom `distance: function( nodeP, nodeQ )` is specified.

fields.name: k
fields.descr: The number of clusters to return.

fields.name: distance

fields.name: 'euclidean'
fields.descr: [Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance) (default)

fields.name: 'squaredEuclidean'
fields.descr: [Squared Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance#Squared_Euclidean_distance)

fields.name: 'manhattan'
fields.descr: [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry)

fields.name: 'max'
fields.descr: [Max distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_norm)

fields.name: function( length, getPAt, getQAt[, nodeP, nodeQ] )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between attribute vectors `p` and `q`.

fields.name: length
fields.descr: The length of the vectors.

fields.name: getPAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `p` vector.

fields.name: getQAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `q` vector.

fields.name: nodeP
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `p` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: nodeQ
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `q` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: function( nodeP, nodeQ )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between `nodeP` and `nodeQ`.  This allows for specifying the distance matrix directly, forgoing attributes.

fields.name: maxIterations
fields.descr: The maximum number of iterations of the algorithm to run (default `10`).

fields.name: 'max'
fields.descr: [Max distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_norm)

fields.name: function( length, getPAt, getQAt[, nodeP, nodeQ] )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between attribute vectors `p` and `q`.

fields.name: length
fields.descr: The length of the vectors.

fields.name: getPAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `p` vector.

fields.name: getQAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `q` vector.

fields.name: nodeP
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `p` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: nodeQ
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `q` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: function( nodeP, nodeQ )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between `nodeP` and `nodeQ`.  This allows for specifying the distance matrix directly, forgoing attributes.

fields.name: linkage
fields.descr: The [linkage criterion](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hierarchical_clustering#Linkage_criteria) for measuring the distance between two clusters; may be one of `'mean'`, `'min'` (a.k.a. `'single'`, default), `'max'` (a.k.a. `'complete'`).

fields.name: mode
fields.descr: The mode of the algorithm.  For `'threshold'` (default), clusters are merged until they are at least the specified distance apart.  For `'dendrogram'`, the clusters are recursively merged using the branches in a [dendrogram](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dendrogram) (tree) structure beyond a specified depth.

fields.name: threshold
fields.descr: In `mode: 'threshold'`, distance threshold for stopping the algorithm.  All pairs of the returned clusters are at least `threshold` distance apart.  Without specifying this value for `mode: 'threshold'`, all clusters will eventually be merged into a single cluster.

fields.name: dendrogramDepth
fields.descr: In `mode: 'dendrogram'`, the depth beyond which branches are merged in the tree.  For example, a value of 0 (default) results in all branches being merged into a single cluster.

fields.name: addDendrogram
fields.descr: In `mode: 'dendrogram'`, whether to add nodes and edges to the graph for the dendrogram (default `false`).  This is not necessary to run the algorithm, but it is useful for visualising the results.

fns.name: nodes.affinityPropagation
fns.descr: Considering only the elements in the calling collection, calculate the [affinity propagation clustering](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affinity_propagation) of the nodes.

fields.name: attributes: [ function( node ) ... ]
fields.descr: An array of attribute functions, each of which returns a numeric attribute value for the specified node.  Attributes are used to cluster the nodes; i.e. two nodes with similar attributes tend to be in the same cluster.  Each attribute may have to be normalised in order for the chosen distance metric to make sense.  Attributes must be specified unless a custom `distance: function( nodeP, nodeQ )` is specified.

fields.name: distance
fields.descr: The distance classifier used to compare attribute vectors.  It is optional if attributes are specified.  It may take on one of several values:

fields.name: 'euclidean'
fields.descr: [Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance) (default)

fields.name: 'squaredEuclidean'
fields.descr: [Squared Euclidean distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Euclidean_distance#Squared_Euclidean_distance)

fields.name: 'manhattan'
fields.descr: [Manhattan distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taxicab_geometry)

fields.name: 'max'
fields.descr: [Max distance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_norm)

fields.name: function( length, getPAt, getQAt[, nodeP, nodeQ] )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between attribute vectors `p` and `q`.

fields.name: length
fields.descr: The length of the vectors.

fields.name: getPAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `p` vector.

fields.name: getQAt(i)
fields.descr: A function that returns the ith value of the `q` vector.

fields.name: nodeP
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `p` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: nodeQ
fields.descr: An optionally-used reference to the node associated with the `q` attribute vector.  It is useful for affecting the weights with information outside of the attributes, such as connectivity.

fields.name: function( nodeP, nodeQ )
fields.descr: A custom function that returns the distance between `nodeP` and `nodeQ`.  This allows for specifying the distance matrix directly, forgoing attributes.

fields.name: preference
fields.descr: The metric used to determine the suitability of a data point (i.e. node attribute vector) to serve as an exemplar.  It may take on one of several special values, which are determined from the similarity matrix (i.e. the negative distance matrix).  Or a manual, numeric value may be used (generally of the opposite sign of your distance values).  The special values include:

fields.name: 'median'
fields.descr: Use the median value of the similarity matrix (default).

fields.name: 'mean'
fields.descr: Use the mean value of the similarity matrix.

fields.name: 'min'
fields.descr: Use the minimum value of the similarity matrix.

fields.name: 'max'
fields.descr: Use the maximum value of the similarity matrix.

fields.name: damping
fields.descr: A damping factor on [0.5, 1) (default `0.8`).

fields.name: minIterations
fields.descr: The minimum number of iteraions the algorithm will run before stopping (default `100`).

fields.name: minIterations
fields.descr: The maximum number of iteraions the algorithm will run before stopping (default `1000`).

fns.name: node.isParent

fns.name: node.isChildless
fns.descr: Get whether the node is childless (i.e. a node with no child nodes)

fns.name: node.isChild
fns.descr: Get whether the node is a compound child (i.e. contained within a node)

fns.name: node.isOrphan
fns.descr: Get whether the node is an orphan (i.e. a node with no parent)

fns.name: nodes.parent
fns.descr: Get the compound parent node of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.ancestors

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.commonAncestors
fns.descr: Get all compound ancestors common to all the nodes in the collection, starting with the closest and getting progressively farther.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.orphans
fns.descr: Get all orphan (i.e. has no compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.nonorphans
fns.descr: Get all nonorphan (i.e. has a compound parent) nodes in the calling collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.children
fns.descr: Get all compound child (i.e. direct descendant) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.descendants
fns.descr: Get all compound descendant (i.e. children, children's children, etc.) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: nodes.siblings
fns.descr: Get all sibling (i.e. same compound parent) nodes of each node in the collection.

args.name: selector
args.descr: A selector used to filter the resultant collection.

fns.name: ani.play
fns.descr: Requests that the animation be played, starting on the next frame.  If the animation is complete, it restarts from the beginning.

fns.name: ani.playing
fns.descr: Get whether the animation is currently playing.

fns.name: ani.progress
fns.descr: Get or set how far along the animation has progressed.

formats.name: ani.progress

formats.name: ani.time
